org.mozilla.jss.tests

Class EnumerationZeroTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mozilla.jss.tests.EnumerationZeroTest

  • public class EnumerationZeroTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to demonstrate DER encoding failure when using an ASN.1 enumerated type with a value of zero. RFC 5280's section 5.3.1 lists the valid values for certificate revocation codes: CRLReason ::= ENUMERATED { unspecified (0), keyCompromise (1), cACompromise (2), affiliationChanged (3), superseded (4), cessationOfOperation (5), certificateHold (6), -- value 7 is not used removeFromCRL (8), privilegeWithdrawn (9), aACompromise (10) }

      • buildAuthorityKeyIdentifier

        public static org.mozilla.jss.netscape.security.x509.AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension buildAuthorityKeyIdentifier(java.security.interfaces.RSAPublicKey key)
                                                                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Calculate the KeyIdentifier for an RSAPublicKey and place it in an AuthorityKeyIdentifier extension. Java encodes RSA public keys using the SubjectPublicKeyInfo type described in RFC 5280. 
         SubjectPublicKeyInfo  ::=  SEQUENCE  {
   algorithm            AlgorithmIdentifier,
   subjectPublicKey     BIT STRING  }

 AlgorithmIdentifier  ::=  SEQUENCE  {
   algorithm               OBJECT IDENTIFIER,
   parameters              ANY DEFINED BY algorithm OPTIONAL  }
        A KeyIdentifier is a SHA-1 digest of the subjectPublicKey bit string from the ASN.1 above.
        Parameters:
        key - the RSAPublicKey to use
        Returns:
        an AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension based on the key
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we can't construct a MessageDigest object.

      • outputExtension

      • buildCrl

        public static java.security.cert.X509CRL buildCrl(boolean useZero)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Build a CRL using JSS
        Parameters:
        useZero - whether or not to try creating a CRLEntry with the reason set to "unspecified"
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if anything goes wrong
